channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Rep. Greene's resignation triggers uncertainty as voters weigh her break with Trump
item.description: Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene is resigning after a break with President Trump made a primary fight inevitable, says Georgia Public Broadcasting reporter Sarah Kallis.
item.content:encoded: Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene is resigning after a break with President Trump made a primary fight inevitable, says Georgia Public Broadcasting reporter Sarah Kallis.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Kallis

item.title: At COP30, nations agree on adaptation funding but remain split on emissions
item.description: Global climate talks in Brazil wrapped up with a deal to increase funding for countries hit by warming but no plan to phase out fossil fuels.
item.content:encoded: Global climate talks in Brazil wrapped up with a deal to increase funding for countries hit by warming but no plan to phase out fossil fuels.
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: Researchers say a CDC website change misrepresents vaccine science
item.description: This week a CDC website briefly suggested a vaccine–autism link, prompting experts to urge the public to rely on credible medical guidance.
item.content:encoded: This week a CDC website briefly suggested a vaccine–autism link, prompting experts to urge the public to rely on credible medical guidance.
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Across Europe, the left searches for its next 'Mamdani'
item.description: The New York mayor-elect's unexpected victory has energized the European left, with politicians casting themselves as their country's version of Mamdani, and strategists eager to study how he won.
item.content:encoded: The New York mayor-elect's unexpected victory has energized the European left, with politicians casting themselves as their country's version of Mamdani, and strategists eager to study how he won.
item.dc:creator: Fatima Al-Kassab

item.title: Is it really a good idea to assign homework?
item.description: Education reporter Holly Korbey and writer Elizabeth Matthew explore why some schools are scaling back homework and whether it helps or hurts students
item.content:encoded: Education reporter Holly Korbey and writer Elizabeth Matthew explore why some schools are scaling back homework and whether it helps or hurts students
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: How one group is turning mushroom's bioelectricity into music
item.description: Bionic and the Wires is a band that makes music by turning the electrical activity of fungi into playable sounds.
item.content:encoded: Bionic and the Wires is a band that makes music by turning the electrical activity of fungi into playable sounds.
item.dc:creator: Gabriel J. Sánchez

item.title: How do producers shape the stories you hear?
item.description: NPR's Jonaki Mehta and Matt Ozug talk about what producers actually do on the radio and how they shape the news listeners hear every day.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Jonaki Mehta and Matt Ozug talk about what producers actually do on the radio and how they shape the news listeners hear every day.
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: The Saudi crown prince's U.S. trip is drawing scrutiny from 9/11 families
item.description: Brett Eagleson, whose father died on 9/11, discusses how families of the victims reacted to the Saudi crown prince's visit to the United States.
item.content:encoded: Brett Eagleson, whose father died on 9/11, discusses how families of the victims reacted to the Saudi crown prince's visit to the United States.
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: Ukrainians react to a proposed peace plan that appears to favor Russia
item.description: Ukraine is under increasing pressure to agree to a peace deal American and Russian negotiators developed.
item.content:encoded: Ukraine is under increasing pressure to agree to a peace deal American and Russian negotiators developed.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: After break with Trump, Marjorie Taylor Greene will resign
item.description: Republican Georgia Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, an "America First" conservative who has clashed with President Trump and her party, said Friday she would resign from Congress Jan. 5, 2026.
item.content:encoded:
Republican Georgia Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, an "America First" conservative who has clashed with President Trump and her party, said Friday she would resign from Congress Jan. 5, 2026.

(Image credit: Daniel Heuer)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler
